intro: Bigelowia douglasii var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bigelowia, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
